intro: Paraboea scabriflora, commonly known as the rough-flowered paraboea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests. Paraboea scabriflora is often found in the understorey of tropical forests, where it thrives in humid conditions.
